alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 2:28PM PST until December 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches along the coast and in the coastal valleys. Amounts will be higher in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast and Curry County Coast, including Brookings, Gold Beach, Port Orford, Bandon, Coos Bay, North Bend, Reedsport, Coquille, and Myrtle Point. Impacts are expected for all area roads and highways. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will rise to around 500 feet above sea level Sunday afternoon, but otherwise snow levels will be near sea level. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
